meanings.definition: Sound produced by the vocal cords
meanings.sent1: The baby's cries filled the room with tiny voices.
meanings.sent2: I could hear distant voices singing in harmony.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous parrot mimicked our voices perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The voices of nature whispered through the trees.
meanings.sent5: The voices of the choir lifted everyone's spirits.

meanings.definition: The right to express opinions or beliefs
meanings.sent1: In a democracy, everyone has the right to raise their voices.
meanings.sent2: The protest was a powerful display of united voices.
meanings.sent3: The voices of the students were heard loud and clear.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was a strong voice for change in the community.
meanings.sent5: The voices of the people echoed through the streets.

meanings.definition: The ability to speak or sing
meanings.sent1: His deep voice resonated through the auditorium.
meanings.sent2: She lost her voice after cheering at the game.
meanings.sent3: The voice of the actor filled the theater with emotion.
meanings.sent4: The singer's voice captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The voice of the storyteller painted vivid images in our minds.

meanings.definition: A particular quality or tone in speech or writing
meanings.sent1: Her voice carried a sense of authority and confidence.
meanings.sent2: The writer's voice in the novel was unique and engaging.
meanings.sent3: The comedic voice in the play had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: His voice in the debate was calm and persuasive.
meanings.sent5: The poetic voice of the author brought tears to our eyes.
